newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australia's Mercantile Mutual half year profit up.
newsitem.headline: Australia's Mercantile Mutual half year profit up.

text.p: Financial services group Mercantile Mutual said on Sunday its net profit for the six months to March 31 rose 70 percent to A$54.6 million from the same period a year earlier.
Mercantile Mutual, owned by ING Groep NV, said group premium income increased 59 percent to A$877 million in the half year while group assets under management rose five percent to A$12.5 billion.

Managing director Rod Atfield said in a statement the group's strong first half performance was largely a result of strong funds management inflow, the contribution of the acquired Pacific Mutual/Armstrong Jones operations and the introduction
of the new margin on services life reporting method.

"Mercantile Mutual is now the market leader in individual life insurance and we have also been highly successful in gaining new group risk clients such as Woolworths Ltd, for whom we have recently written the largest employee income protection of its kind in Australia," Atfield said.
Life and funds management operations recorded a net profit of A$34 million, a 95 percent increase on the previous year.
Net profit from general insurance operations fell four percent to A$11 million.
